name: EasyBeadPatterns Pattern
summary: Learn about .PTNX files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: EasyBeadPatterns is a free program that beaders can use to mock up beading patterns and determine what beads they need to reproduce a pattern in real life. When beaders save an EasyBead pattern, it is saved as a PTNX file. The PTNX file's text specifies the pattern's stitch and size, as well as the locations at which different-colored beads are placed. Each bead's color is identified by a bead ID, and its location is specified by the row and col settings.

After opening a PTNX file in EasyBeadPattern, beaders can convert the file to a JPG or PDF that can be opened in any image- or PDF-viewing application. Beaders can also print patterns directly from EasyBeadPattern, to use them as physical beading guides.

instructions: You can open a PTNX file and view the bead pattern it contains in EasyBeadPattern (Windows, Mac). To do so, select File â†’ Open from the program's menu bar.
If you want to view the XML text a PTNX file contains, you can open the file in any text editor.
